identificationModule.officialTitle: A Portal-based Advance Care Planning Intervention Among Community-Dwelling Persons Living With Cognitive Impairment

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this research is to learn about the patient's experience completing the Care Planning questions in the MyChart (MyAtriumHealth) account.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The goal of this study is to explore whether sending an electronic Advanced Care Planning (ACP) tool (ACPVoice) paired with a motivational message within the patient portal approximately four weeks before a routine primary care physician visit (preferably the Medicare annual wellness visit) can improve ACP reach and adoption within the electronic health record among persons living with cognitive impairment. In addition, examining whether sending the ACPVoice tool paired with a motivational message within the patient portal improves ACP documentation, ACP billing, and examine acceptability, appropriateness, and satisfaction among primary care physicians and patients.

armGroups.label: Advance Care Planning Portal Reminders
armGroups.description: Community-dwelling persons living with cognitive impairment aged 65 and older with known or probable mild cognitive impairment or dementia or elevated eRADAR score (with decision-making capacity), who are affiliated with the Atrium-Wake Forest Baptist Health Accountable Care Organization, have a primary care physician at one of the participating sites, and have an active patient portal account (MyAtriumHealth).

interventions.name: Advance Care Planning Tool - ACPVoice
interventions.description: Eligible patients will be sent a secure MyChart message asking them to complete the advance care planning tool (ACPVoice) portal-based tool with their care partner/surrogate decision-maker or loved one before their upcoming provider visit. The ACPVoice portal-based tool questions (called Care Planning for My Care Team Questionnaire" in encompass) will be attached to the portal message. This message will be sent up to approximately 4 weeks prior to their upcoming primary care physician visit. A reminder message will be sent approximately 5-7 days later to non-responders with a different motivational message with the tool attached again to the message.

interventions.name: Standard Advance Care Planning
interventions.description: Patients will have access to the standardized version of the tool called "ACP For my care team questionnaire," which is already available within their MyChart (MyAtriumHealth) account. The patient will not be prompted to complete the tool and will not receive motivational messages/calls.

otherOutcomes.description: Data will be collected via qualitative interviews. The following barriers to adoption among non-adopters (those who did not complete the advance care planning tool (ACPVoice): difficulty navigating my chart (computer literacy) will be assessed: technology issues, not interested in answering advance care planning questions, too busy, found questions too hard to answer, preference for direct communication, or any other barriers.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months during the implementation period and up to 6 months post the implementation period

otherOutcomes.description: Will measure the total number of eligible patients at participating sites and within our health network who have a patient portal account and also measure the total number of eligible patients who have an "active" account.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months during the implementation period and up to 6 months post the implementation period

otherOutcomes.measure: Quality of Advance Care Planning Documentation
otherOutcomes.description: High-quality advance care planning documentation will be defined as addressing ≥4 of the 8 core components with 1 point assigned for each of the following questions related to: health-related goals, what matters most/most important in their life, health-related worries/concerns, named surrogate decision-maker, how much information they would like to know, unacceptable states at the end-of-life, goals if their health was to worsen, and questions about advance care planning forms. Score of 0-8 with 0 indicating no advance care planning questions answered to 8 indicating eight core advance care planning questions answered.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months during the implementation period and up to 6 months post the implementation period

otherOutcomes.description:
Data will be collected via a RedCap survey asking the following 5 questions:

i. How confident are you your primary care clinician/team knows what is important to you? (0-10) ii. How confident are you that what is important to you will determine the medical care you receive in the future? (0-10) iii. To what extent did completing this care planning tool increase or decrease your sense of control over medical decisions? (1-5 scale, 3 = no change, 5 = increased a lot) iv. Before completing the care planning tool, did your primary care clinician/team ask what is important to you? (0=No; 1=Yes, somewhat; 2=Yes, definitely) v. After completing the care planning tool, did your primary care clinician/team ask what is important to you? (0=No; 1=Yes, somewhat; 2=Yes, definitely)
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months during the implementation period and up to 6 months post the implementation period

otherOutcomes.description: Data will be assessed via a RedCap survey. The Feeling Heard and Understood measure is based on responses to four survey items using a response scale of: "Completely true", "Very true", "Somewhat true", "A little bit true", and "Not at all true".
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months during the implementation period and up to 6 months post the implementation period

otherOutcomes.description: Data will be assessed via a RedCap survey among adopters of the advance care planning tool (ACPVoice) and non-adopters during qualitative interviews. Data will be measured using the Brief Digital Health Care Literacy Scale. This measure has 3 survey items using a response scale of strong disagree (0) to strongly agree (4). Sum score of individual items, possible score 0-12, with higher scores indicating higher digital health care literacy.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months during the implementation period and up to 6 months post the implementation period

otherOutcomes.measure: Telephone Advance Care Planning Completion Rates
otherOutcomes.description: Defined as the number of patients who complete the advance care planning tool (ACPVoice) over the telephone.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months during the implementation period and up to 6 months post the implementation period

otherOutcomes.measure: Paper Advance Care Planning Documentation Rates
otherOutcomes.description: Defined as the number of patients who were mailed and completed the advance care planning tool (ACPVoice) via mail.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months during the implementation period and up to 6 months post the implementation period

otherOutcomes.measure: Advance Care Planning Documentations Rates by Patients Through Portal Based Tool
otherOutcomes.description: Documentation of advance care planning within the electronic health record through the portal. Defined as documentation either using the standardized questionnaire (Advance Care Planning for My Care Team questionnaire) or use of our new ACPVoice questionnaire (Care Planning for My Care Team Questionnaire)
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months during the implementation period and up to 6 months post the implementation period

otherOutcomes.description: Data will be collected via Redcap survey. Survey includes one question - "How strongly do you agree or disagree that your current medical/treatment plan meets your preferences?" Response options included (1) strongly disagree, (2) disagree, (3) slightly disagree, (4) slightly agree, (5) agree, or (6) strongly agree.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months during the implementation period and up to 6 months post the implementation period

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Diagnosis of recognized or probable mild cognitive impairment or mild dementia or elevated eRADAR score
* Completed visit with their primary care provider (PCP) within the past 12 months and have upcoming PCP visit in next 6 months
* Have an active patient portal account (MyAtriumHealth)
* Affiliated with an Accountable Care Organization

Exclusion Criteria:

* Lives in a long-term care facility
* Severe vision impairment/blindness (as they need to be able to read portal messages)
* Enrolled in hospice
* Lacks decisional capacity as deemed by PCP
